The article presents a software development project for an easy-med hospital management system that integrates with SPSS for research purposes. The system features dynamic forms and image entry for data input, aiming to support specialized hospitals and primary healthcare facilities in improving good health and well-being.

The article discusses an alternative communication platform for Ethiopian health institutions using DTN technology. The platform aims to enhance reliability, address TCP/IP issues, and deliver sensitive information securely. It is well-suited for rural areas due to the toleration of delaying conditions by the DTN network.

The article discusses Axiom Financial Technologies' Mizan Credit Score system, which measures credit risk for businesses and individuals. It highlights the platform's ability to provide access to finance for unbanked sections of society and its integration with financial institutions and payment systems.

The article presents an online platform for managing work permits, which is a key aspect of the 'fin tech' category. It highlights features such as digital documentation, time and energy saving, and physical contact-free processes, indicating a focus on efficiency and innovation. The absence of any mention of other categories suggests that this article primarily focuses on financial technology.

The article discusses the implementation of an Electronic Procurement System (E-Procurement) for government services, highlighting its features and functionalities. The system includes a web application and mobile application platforms, covering all functions in procurement from pre-tendering to post-tendering. It aims to improve efficiency and transparency in the procurement process.

The article focuses on the development of a customized human resource management system that aims to simplify tasks for HR experts. It highlights various features such as employee information management, performance evaluation mechanisms, and reporting capabilities. The system is designed to cater to different stakeholders within an organization.

The article discusses the potential of vertical farming on a substrate made from recycled SDGs (Sustainable Development Goals) bags, specifically focusing on reducing waste. It touches upon Zero Hunger and Good Health and Well-being goals by mentioning organic foods and sustainable agriculture. The article also briefly mentions water conservation as part of its thematic areas.

The article primarily focuses on the logistics company's technology-driven platform for freight shipment needs. It highlights key features such as Freight Booking, Bidding and negotiations, Real-time tracking, and Status update. The thematic areas mentioned include digital platforms, e-governance, and e-services, indicating a focus on innovative solutions for logistics and services.
